intro: Senecio pterophorus var. verus, commonly known as the yellow star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow, daisy-like flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has linear, grass-like leaves and is often found in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It is a perennial herb that can grow up to 30 centimeters tall, and its flowers attract various pollinators, including bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
